meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inward or internal.
meanings.sent1: Her inwardness showed in the way she kept her thoughts to herself.
meanings.sent2: The cat's inwardness was evident as it curled up in a secluded corner.
meanings.sent3: His inwardness was so extreme that he never shared his feelings with anyone.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the inwardness of the forest in his painting, revealing its hidden beauty.
meanings.sent5: The novel's description of the character's inwardness made the readers empathize with her struggles.

meanings.sent1: The inwardness of the cave was explored by the brave spelunkers.
meanings.sent2: The tree's inwardness was protected by its thick bark.
meanings.sent3: The mystery novel revealed the inwardness of the crime scene in a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: The scientist studied the inwardness of the cell to understand its functions better.
meanings.sent5: The explorer marveled at the inwardness of the ancient ruins, hidden beneath layers of history.
